channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped Mattress & Furniture on Pavement, 15th January
item.description:
Dumped mattress and cabinet on pavement, near the bus shelter opposite the library.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Road, Longlands, Greater London

item.title: Broken bin bags - litter across street, 15th January
item.description:
Nappies, old toilet brushes and other items across the street in this area again, as a result of the permanently overflowing bins outside 118 and the back of Kenyon House
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Church Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Pothole in road, 15th January
item.description:
Been here at least two weeks and if your wheel goes down it then tyre could burst
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5-7, Chislehurst Road, Goddington, Orpington, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Forest electric cycle, 15th January
item.description:
A Forest electric cycle has been abandoned on footway Maple Crescent j/w Wellington Avenue Blackfen. Please can this be collected by the Company who own the cycle. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots causing a tripping hazzatd, 15th January
item.description:
All the trees on the odd side of the street have raised tree roots that are breaking through the pavements. Tripping hazard and may u see mine properties
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Talfourd Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed and non-MOT'd vehicle - vandalised, 15th January
item.description:
White Mercedes van has been parked outside 22 John Harrison Way for two months - vehicle is untaxed and no valid MOT. The front passenger side window has now been smashed and the side door does not appear locked.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): John Harrison Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2nd pothole in Pickford Lane, 15th January
item.description:
2 potholes both badly repaired so the have just reopened up next to the substandard repair. Resulting in road debris being sprayed all over the path when the buses and cars hit the potholes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Pickford Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep and Dangerous Pothole, 15th January
item.description:
A pothole has been formed in the last week or so, it is now very deep and big enough to catch normal car’s wheels. It is also possible to cause an accident as drivers need to veer and invade the other lane to avoid damaging their suspension and wheels (tyres and rims). It is on the left hand side of the road when driving towards east end road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28,26, Manor View, Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive fly tipping, 15th January
item.description:
This is around the corner of Eltham Palace Road where it meets Middle PARK Avenue. By the mini roundabout. A shopping trolley and assorted bags of rubbish spilling out on to pavement as well as bags and bags of rubbish thrown over the fence into the playing fields

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middle Park Avenue, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs left over from road works lie in pavement, 15th January
item.description:
This is not fr from the pedestrian crossing, on the opposite side of the road from.Mottingham train station A sandbag , sign and the metal stand left on pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Station Approach Southside, Mottingham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches need to be cut around tree base blocking access to pavement, 15th January
item.description:
Tree branches need to be cut around the tree base on the junction between Goodrich Road and Barry Road, where the zebra crossing is located. This causes the tree roots to overgrow and creates a trip hazard to access around the pavement. Please, could the branches be cut right back as the pavement is narrow.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing paving slabs around tree roots Barry Road, 15th January
item.description:
Missing paving slabs around tree roots on the junction between Goodrich Road and Barry Road, where the zebra crossing is located, causing the tree roots to overgrow and creating a trip hazard to access around the pavement. Please, could it be cemented over or filled in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 105 Fordwych Road, 15th January

Broken pavement slab, huge trip hazard as unlit at night. Needs repair ASAP.

item.title: Dumped, 15th January
item.description:
This Cul De Sac has only a few parking spots for the residents who live here and this car isn’t one of them. Myself and my neighbours who are disabled and have kids have to park on the road for people like this who dump their car here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alnwick Road, Eltham
